u.a: Wawrzon and his father are repairing the radio. They are sitting on the floor near the record player and the shelf with records.
"Skaldowie" is a name of a pop music group .
I dońt know what it is for you know ?
all right, so are we going to fix this radio Wawrzon ?
where did you plug it in ?
I turned it off so that we dońt get the electric shock .
this is the wire you know ?
for the socket . but you dońt plug it into the socket do you ?
listen I think this is a microphone, you just found (it) you know ?
for the radio, yes, I think so .
it is a play on the words "Dick" and "dzik".
who took it Dick or Eddie ?
who took our tape recorder this time ?
here we go . should I put it on ?
Father takes the record but does not want to play it .
but I've unplugged it so the record player wońt play .
no, this is for the amplifier .
the correct accusative case of "ta" (this one) is "tę", but most Polish people use the form "tą"; therefore it is not coded as incorrect in Wawrzońs speech .
come on, we areńt going to play this one . I think the fuse is blown you know ?
yes . so what are we going to do now ?
Wawrzon is trying to put the record into a sleeve .
I want to put the record in .
are you going to put it into this bag ?
Father wants Wawrzon to say something about the Christmas tree .
say that we were decorating the Christmas tree . what ornaments did we have ?
what Christmas tree did I have ?
and where is our Christmas tree ?
he points in the direction of the balcony .
a little later Father has repaired the radio . Wawrzon has put the record into the sleeve . Wawrzon is looking for the cover .
the light on the dial must be on .
this record did not have a cover .
oh yes . this one is for the carols . but this record did not have one you know .
Wawrzon looks for the opening in the cover .
well you have to try again .
after a while Wawrzon is still trying to slip the record into the sleeve .
I am not playing the record .
so you areńt playing this record are you ?
I am not playing this record .
no . so maybe we will turn off the record player now ?
the correct form of the pronoun is "tę".
should I put this one on that one ?
but wońt you want to listen to another record then ?
but I dońt know if you can do it like that .
so what else will you tell us ?
Wawrzon is playing with the light bulbs .
a little later Father and Wawrzon are repairing the radio . Wawrzon sees the radio without the casing .
yes . you know I guess the light bulbs are in there ...
Father does not finish the sentence .
a radio . I see it like that for the first time myself .
yes . you know I guess the light bulbs are in there ...
Father does not finish the sentence .
the bulbs . maybe they are blown .
yes . they are blown for sure .
the radio wire is plugged into the socket .
just dońt touch anything here now .
Father checks the bulbs . Wawrzon tries to touch the radio .
Wawrzon wants to press the button .
I have to turn everything off .
no, dońt turn it on now .
no . you know what, bring me a newspaper .
Wawrzon goes to the other room to bring the newspaper .
just one paper there under the table .
not in the kitchen, in the room .
Wawrzon enters the room holding a newspaper in his hand .
Father puts the radio on the paper .
we must find out why these bulbs are going like that .
here is the bulb and we must screw it out . look, it is all black . it means it is blown .
Wawrzon picks up a radio part .
something doesńt work right in this radio .
here the radio doesńt work the bulb . another bulb .

yes they are blown . so what are we going to do ?

I hope so . but dońt touch anything, okey ?
maybe you should move away a little more . like this .

Father plugs the radio wire into the socket and turns on the radio .
I turned it on . but we still have to ...
no dońt turn this on now .
oh something is impossibly wrong here .
well, it's acceptable now, isńt it .

now it turns off . good . all right .
no dońt turn it on, dońt Wawrzon .

well this is a dial . here are the holes .

you dońt do anything with this . it's for the record player .
with this . for the record player .
let's do it later, not now . and what did you want to pour it on ?
not here . on the record player .
we will clean it but later . first we have to fix the radio .
a bowl . there is a bowl .
a little later Wawrzon still wants to pour the liquid on the radio .
why would you want to pour it out ?
no . this liquid is for cleaning the needle . I'll show you how to do it in a minute .
let me finish with the radio first .
just dońt open it yet, all right ?
I'll show you in a minute . but I have to finish with the radio because we are fixing the radio first areńt we ?
we have to buy our own screwdrivers .
there was a seal . now let's see if it works .
it's on . let's turn it off, all right ?

no no no we wońt . no no no we wońt pour on the needle .

Father is imitating Wawrzońs incorrect pronunciation . Wawrzon has a tendency to front the palatals; however, in this body of data the standard adult phonology is used therefore these errors are not coded elsewhere .
now it's ok . it should work now .
Father is thinking about the radio .
so I can put those records back on the shelf now ?
they will get dirty . records shouldńt lie on the floor you know .
we wońt play this (one) but that (one) .
interjection to describe that somebody fell down .
daddy . yes . damn . (he) fell down in front of the house .

the correct form is "jak to się robi ?"
but you wońt be doing it, okey ?
but roll up the paper first .

then put it away . throw it in the garbage in the other garbage can .
why are you going to blow ?
Father wants to tidy up the room .
we can throw out these bulbs now .
I still want to show you how the microphone works .
all right, microphone . let's see where we plug it in .

so are we going to see ?
Father plugs the microphone into the radio .
Wawrzon looks at the tape recorder standing on the shelf .
it will fall behind the record player .
and where do you have it ?
so what did you do with it ?
and did you give it to him ?
a little later Warzońs friend Bartek has come to visit . Wawrzon is in the kitchen .
and maybe we will be building .

Wawrzon is in the room . Mother gives him a rolling pin, a spoon and some other tools for making dough .

and what do you do with it ?
Wawrzon starts looking at the tape recorder .
but it is already turned on .
Bartek is playing with building blocks . Wawrzon interrupts him .
Wawrzon is disturbing Bartek in his play .
Bartek has made something from blocks and Warzon destroys it .
Father enters the room and wants Wawrzon to make a pie .
show me how you can cook .
I just have to take care of one thing .
no I want to build . a bridge .

Kasia is pointing to the picture .
do you want to read or not ?
